paragraphs.body: Kay, so I was chatting with Minn earlier, and we got onto the subject of the UI, and she mentioned something. She thought that it was strange that we only had three interviews to choose from, and that DSV wasn't one of them. It got me thinking - seeing as how it was Nozus's idea to do the User Interview, and he nominated before he was blocked, and his blocking had nothing to do with fanon, it would be reasonable to add it in. What do you guys think? I mean, three interviews to choose from isn't really enough, if you know what I mean. I just seems like there isn't a lot of choice - especially because all three aren't necessarily that new, and all are popular. I haven't seen a lot of DSV. What are your thoughts? Frui (🌹 • 🐝 • 🐝🐝) 11:54, May 20, 2013 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: Alrighty, so, this is just a short discussion to introduce two items; a new policy, and the interview of the year.
paragraphs.text: Alrighty, so, this is just a short discussion to introduce two items; a new policy, and the interview of the year.

paragraphs.body: This year, I want to try something a little different; I want to put a small article in both the BSST and the WLS about it, and create a separate blog post, and basically ask people to comment what story they want to hear about from the author. The only condition is that it can't be Minnichi (due to being interview last year) and it has to be a story that is still active. We then interview the author with the most votes. I want to change it to talk about all their stories, if they have a few (like, if people want us to interview Minnichi—using her as an example because we can't—then we all read a different story of hers and ask questions based on the story, and her as a writer. Of course, this is all just a suggestion, so if anyone has a better one, go ahead ^^"

paragraphs.body: The second is that I want to implement a rule similar to the FRS's 5 one-shot policy. This is for a few reasons, though the main one really is that it's hard to get enough questions out of a one-shot. The reason the FRS enacted it was also to try and avoid getting people writing just for a review, though I don't think we have that problem ^^"
